metadata.dc:description: Treatment failure in community-acquired pneumonia is defined as a clinical condition with inadequate response to antimicrobial therapy. Resistant and unusual microorganisms and noninfectious causes are responsible for treatment failure. Coccidioides immitis is a fungus that causes pneumonia in the northern hemisphere, especially in the United States and northern Mexico. We report a case of pulmonary coccidioidomycosis imported from Mexico to Chile. After a comprehensive study, histopathology was able to establish Coccidiodes immitis as the causative agent, achieving clinical and radiological improvement with antifungal therapy.
metadata.dc:title: Falla de tratamiento en neumonía adquirida en la comunidad: coccidioidomicosis en un viajero.
[Treatment failure in community-acquired pneumonia: coccidioidomycosis in a traveler patient].
